projectPurpose: To simplify and automate the process of packaging and distributing Rust applications for various platforms.
mainFeatures: Automated application packaging for Rust projects
Creates distributable binaries, tarballs, and installers
Generates machine-readable manifests of build artifacts
Assists with hosting, publishing, and announcing releases

alternatives.name: NSIS (Nullsoft Scriptable Install System)
mainFeatures: Small overhead and suitable for internet distribution

alternatives.name: WiX Toolset
alternatives.license: Open Source (Microsoft Reciprocal License - MS-RL, with Maintenance Fee)
mainFeatures: Creates MSI, MSM, MSP, and EXE packages

alternatives.name: InstallBuilder
mainFeatures: Cross-platform installers from a single project file

alternatives.name: cargo-wix
mainFeatures: Cargo subcommand for Windows MSI creation

marketPositioning: cargo-dist is positioned as a specialized, opinionated, and deeply integrated build tool within the Rust ecosystem for automating the end-to-end release and distribution of compiled applications across multiple platforms. Unlike general-purpose installer tools that require platform-specific configuration, cargo-dist leverages Cargo metadata to streamline the creation of various distributable formats (tarballs, installers) and assists with the overall release workflow, aiming to be a comprehensive, batteries-included solution for Rust developers distributing their applications.
